findings.title: MRM - Missing Revert Messages
findings.description: The contract is missing error messages. These missing error messages are making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure they cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and requires careful testing and debugging to ensure correctness.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
